column4: I have a problem. My sound is extremely soft and almost unhearable in any program at max volume. Is there a way to fix this?
there are at least 3 volume settings, make sure each is at a reasonable level
I found 2) 1st is my laptop, second is the volume button on the top toolbar. Where's the third?
right-click that and select volume control
that worked, but I discovered that my laptop controls do absolutely nothing. Is there anyone to fix this?
there are packages to deal with that , for specific laptops
apt-cache search laptop, or something :)
I have this long list of dealies. how do I process any of this?
I don't know what you mean
what do I do with any of these things
you search through them to see if anything matches your laptop make/model
and there's also a generic set of tools for laptop controls
so once I find something that might apply to me, what do I do with it?
you install it in the normal way
I am a complete noob. What is the normal way?
ah.. in that case just use synaptic
Synaptic?
have you only just now installed ubuntu ? like, 5 minutes ago ?
well 5 hours ago, but the idea is the same
synaptic is the normal way of installing software, it's in the system menu
explore your system!
oh that thing, right, I've been playing around with that
